attributes.action: stop the DVLA calling VED "road tax" and "road fund licence" in advertising
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Road Tax has not existed since 1936, and motorists often assume they are paying road tax and use this against other road users as an excuse for lack of respect.

The reason it was abolished in 1936 was to avoid this.

In 1936, the "road tax" raided by Churchill back in 1926, halting it in all but name, was finally abolished and was never brought back.

Now, we have VED – Vehicle Excise Duty, a tax on motorised emissions.



Yet... DVLA keeps referring to VED in their advertising and paper work as Road Tax. This needs to stop.

reasons: False or incomplete name or address information
